oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-10-25 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 25, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer), guest performers Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, and regular performers Fred Smith, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, June Carter, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 994th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Porter Wagoner; Fred Smith; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Porter Wagoner -- Tell Her Lies And Feed Her Candy (Porter Wagoner) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Fred Smith -- Comedy routine (Fred Smith, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Brand New Shoes (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (Fred Smith, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Mississippi Sawyer (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Porter Wagoner and Grant Turner talk -- What Would You Do (If Jesus Came To Your House) (Porter Wagoner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Smith, Fred E., 1924-2006; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Wagoner, Porter; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys
